Data:
==Applies To==

* Android applications that cache data.

==What to Do==

Do not cache sensitive data.

==Why==

Avoid caching sensitive data to prevent this data from falling into the wrong hands if the device is stolen or compromised.

==How==

To prevent caching of sensitive data:

# **Identify sensitive data.** Make a list of all sensitive information handled by your application. Some examples are:
#* Passwords
#* Encryption keys
#* Personal information
# **Identify code that creates temporary files used by the application.** Review the functions in the application source code that are responsible for creating the temporary files. Find any such functions that write sensitive data.
# **Remove code that writes sensitive data to temporary files.** Edit the functions that write sensitive data to temporary files to prevent caching of sensitive data.

==Privacy Guidelines==

* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000561ff3|Do Not Cache Sensitive Data]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000007e1362|Do Not Log Location Data]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000001dcb79|Do Not Log Sensitive Data]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000629cc3|Delete Cached Data after Use]]

==Privacy Checklists==

* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000003b2aca|Sensitive Data Is Not Cached]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000006c27b2|Location Data Is Not Logged]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000005a7753|Sensitive Data Is Not Logged]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000007c99a7|Cached Data Is Deleted after Use]]
